Grahame Grieve said:

https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/tx.fhir.org+Documentation

Suggestion to add that confluence link to the http://tx.fhir.org/ landing page :), or redirect from http://tx.fhir.org/docs
that's probably a good idea, but that page is generic for the server, not specific to tx.fhir.org. I'll think about that
Thank you for that. It's greatly appreciated.

Does this include publisher support for chaining terminology servers, or allowing multiple servers to be specified? Or is the intent that someone runs a full duplicate of tx.fhir.org plus their local terminology?
• it's on my feature list to allow delegation of code systems on the server
• I don't think that I can manage multiple terminology servers, since value sets can cross code systems
The purpose of this is to resolve issues for people who have security or performance concerns - they can run a full clone of tx.fhir.org now.
you could already nominate your own server and provide it
